summary: The Solanaceae family includes many common plants like tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant, and peppers. These plants are related and often contain powerful chemicals called alkaloids. Some are useful as food, medicine, or spices, while others can be poisonous. The family has over 2,700 species worldwide, mostly in South America. It's named after the genus Solanum, which includes potatoes and tomatoes. Scientists use some Solanaceae plants, like tobacco and petunia, to study important biological questions.
title: Solanaceae
